body:
Same issue here:

It is possible to deactivate the arm64 library in build.gradle as workaround? So that Android 64bit devices use the armabi-v7a library?

```
Build fingerprint: 'lge/p1_global_com/p1:6.0/MRA58K/153171114f28c:user/release-keys'
Revision: '11'
ABI: 'arm64'
pid: 7260, tid: 8208, name: Chrome_InProcGp  >>> (my app name) <<<
```

> 1. modify gradle files to use LibGDX 1.9.1 and the new 64 bit libraries

Have you tried the newest libgdx setup app? I guess that it addresses this issue.

It provides updated libs for the 64-bit platforms.

http://www.badlogicgames.com/wordpress/?p=3897

Kind regards,
Serhii
@serhii-k:Seems he used V1.9.1 already and I sure did. Nonetheless my app seems to crash on android 64bit devices.
Hi @Trurl101, please, can you check the size of your android/libs/arm64-v8a and android/libs/x86_64 folders together. It should be 2'050'384 bytes.

arm64: 977.776
x86_64: 1.072.608
= 2.050.384

Because I have no 64bit android device I can not test this issue. But have already two related crash reports in my Google developer console.

Side note: I just deleted the 64bit libraries and corresponding lines in build.gradle and android-build.gradle. Google Play shows only "armeabi, armeabi-v7a, x86" as native platforms now. Hopefully this fix the crash reports until I can further discover this issue.
@Trurl101, I'm sorry. It really is an issue... I have just run an app with the source of @jonasbark and can confirm that it crashes on Galaxy S6...

@Trurl101 , by the way, you can run a remote Galaxy S6 device here to test your app:
http://developer.samsung.com/remotetestlab/rtlDeviceList.action

This has been tested on android emulators, I've just given it a go on the link @serhii-k posted on the S6, and it runs there too. ![](http://pix.asidik.com/tomski-66ZHjy.png)

I believe it was also tested on one of the 64bit nexus devices by @badlogic.  I don't know if anyone working with source has this device to confirm/test with?
You got a sigsegv, that should be unrelated to 64-bitness. Please provide the crashing app, i have an ARM64 device.

You can remove the 64-bit binaries by
1. Deleteing android/libs
2. Removing the xxx-natives-arm64 entries in you Android dependencies
3. Sync Gradle (or run any Gradle task)

android/libs then shouldn't contain the arm64-v8b and x86_64 folders
I can reproduce the crash with your APK. Will try to debug ShapeRenderer later tonight.
@Trurl101 your stack trace is from Chrome, what's up with that?
